Website Sign In How Do I... Government Services Residents Business Visitors Search Home Government Departments Leisure Services Special Events Special Events There are two types of Special Events in the City of Cocoa Beach. First are events that are run by City personnel. Examples of these are the Fall into Winter 5K Run, Breakfast with Santa, and the annual Easter Egg Hunt. The other type of events held within the City by organized and sponsored by outside parties. Examples of these would be the Easter Surf Contest and The Cocoa Beach Art Show. Want in hold a Special Event in Cocoa Beach? The City of Cocoa Beach celebrates special events for their contributions to cultural, community and economic growth. We are pleased you have selected Cocoa Beach as the site for your special event. Cocoa Beach strives to provide excellent customer service while facilitating your event needs. City Event Coordination staff oversee the outdoor special event permitting process. We serve as a resource to assist event organizers during event planning and will coordinate the collaborative involvement of City resources. Depending on the scope of your event, a number of City departments may be involved in the logistics necessary to produce a safe and successfully executed event. The Outdoor Special Event Permit Application will facilitate these requirements. The Special Event Resolution has been developed for you to use as a reference while you complete your application. The Resolution provides a review of the process and key information needed during the planning stages of your event. Application Process To begin the application process, submit the Special Events Application through the City’s OpenGov portal. Once received, City staff will review your submission and follow up with any requests for additional information or documentation. After all required materials have been provided, you will be invited to a Special Events Committee meeting. This meeting includes representatives from key City departments and is designed to review your event details, address safety considerations, and finalize logistics to help ensure a successful event. For complete information on hosting special events in the City of Cocoa Beach, including application requirements, fees, and approval processes, please refer to Chapter 14: Special Events of our Code of Ordinances. Below is a breakdown of documents and responsibilities associated with each stage of the process: Documents Required for the Special Events Committee Meeting: Complete site plan Complete parking plan (including property owner approvals, if applicable) Sanitation site plan (trash and portable toilets – number determined by the City) Dune protection plan (if required) Letter from upland property owner authorizing use of the location (if required) Notification letter or postcard to surrounding businesses/residents (if required by ordinance) Proof of insurance naming the City of Cocoa Beach as an additional insured Security needs (number of officers determined by Police and Fire Departments) Documents Required Before the Permit Can Be Issued: All required items listed above must be on file Sea Turtle Lighting Permit (if event occurs between March 1 and November 1) Proof of Temporary Business Tax Receipts for all event vendors Payment of all applicable City fees Event Promoter Responsibilities: Schedule building inspections, if required Schedule Fire inspections, if required Schedule lifeguards through Brevard County, if required Post-Event Requirements: Remove all signs and banners within 24 hours of event completion Clean up the event site immediately after the event ends Remove all trash cans and portable toilets within 24 hours (or by the following Monday if the event ends on a weekend or holiday) If you have any questions, please contact the City Event Coordination Staff at 321-868-3252 or via email . We are here to support you throughout the planning process and look forward to helping make your event a success in the City of Cocoa Beach. Contact Us Recreation Center 321 Ramp Road Cocoa Beach, FL 32931 Ph: 321-868-3274 Hours Monday through Thursday 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM Friday 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM Closed on the weekends and all major holidays. Summer at Journey Messages Give LiveStream Leadership Team New Here Find Us Plan a Visit Leadership Team Journey Church Staff Team Scott Edinger Lead Pastor scott@journeysherwood.org Olivia Pothoff Pastor of Worship & Care olivia@journeysherwood.org Gabe Nielsen Director of Journey Youth gabe@journeysherwood.org Olivia Cuddeford Director of Journey Kids oliviac@journeysherwood.org Journey Church Leadership Board The Leadership Board at Journey Church is made up of six members of the Journey Church family and the Lead Pastor. They are assigned to help guide, equip, and empower the pastors and staff at Journey Church to fulfill the mission and vision that God has uniquely given us. Our current Leadership Board members: Megan O’Connell, Jon Burgi, Lacey McNay, Ed Hatch, Amy Schlapper, Josh Thoreson. If you have any questions for the Leadership Board please email: leadershipboard@journeysherwood.org Back to Top Events Messages FOLLOWING JESUS TOGETHER Phone 503.610.0759 Email info@journeysherwood.org Gather 22689 SW Pine Street, Sherwood, OR Mail PO Box 322, Sherwood, OR 97140 Subscribe To Our Weekly Update Sign up with your email address to receive our weekly email updates.
